Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown ribbed pottery vessel, the fabric is grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink, containing a receipt.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.158)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (36345) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/36345)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 208 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
